definition: no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
cause/reason/karma/fate/predestined affinity/margin/hem/edge/along
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead

sentences.english: The cake maker shakes a naked snake with the qusimilarg rake without sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕製造者無緣無故地用寒戰的耙子擺一條赤裸的蛇。

sentences.english: This can cause tests to fail gratuitously.
sentences.chinese: 這會導致測試無緣無故地失敗。

sentences.english: The cake dor shakes a naked snake dawn the quaking rake lacking sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕製造者無緣無故地用抖動的耙子搖一條赤的蛇。

sentences.english: She sometimes angers with little or no provocation.
sentences.chinese: 她有時無緣無故就生氣。

sentences.english: My report of resignation was fall into abeyance without sake.
sentences.chinese: 我的辭職報告無緣無故被擱置了。

sentences.english: Regularly checked rail lines, but derailments without apparent cause.
sentences.chinese: 定期接受檢查的鐵路線，但是卻無緣無故地脫軌。

sentences.english: He was steaming badly over nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他無緣無故地亂髮脾氣。
“無緣無故”只能說是半真半假。

sentences.english: The gas company cut off our gas supply for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 煤氣公司無緣無故中斷了我們的煤氣供應。

sentences.english: When peoples are mean to you for no reason. The reason is usually jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 當一個人無緣無故對你很小氣苛刻，通常是因爲嫉妒。

sentences.english: He had been trying to fancy them causeless , but could not.
sentences.chinese: 他曾試圖想象他們無緣無故，但不能。

sentences.english: It is illegal to demote an employee without reason.
sentences.chinese: 無緣無故將一名員工降級是違法的。

sentences.english: Shadowsong Panther will no longer prematurely despawn.
sentences.chinese: 影歌紫豹現在不會中途無緣無故消失了。

sentences.english: He often loses his temper for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他常常無緣無故地使性子。

sentences.english: There are unreasoned joys, inexplicable miseries, laughters and remorses without a cause.
sentences.chinese: 時常有無緣無故的興奮，痛苦，歡笑和悔恨。

sentences.english: He put me down for nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 他無緣無故地斥責了我一頓。

definition: lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
double standard
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
(coll.) to go crazy/to lose it/demented/unhinged
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to cease to be faithful
intolerable
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
